impact-statement: SpoIIIE forms a protein channel that spans the two lipid bilayers of the septum and mediates chromosome translocation and reversible membrane fission during <italic>Bacilus subtilis</italic> sporulation.

equal-contrib.equal-contrib: These authors contributed equally to this work

contribution.con1: JYS, Constructed the strains to visualize SpoIIIE by PALM, Performed the PALM experiments, Analysed the PALM data, Developed the project and interpreted the results, Wrote the manuscript
contribution.con2: JL-G, Developed the cell-specific protein degradation system and performed the experiments and analyzed the data of FRAP and chromosome translocation efficiency, Constructed the strains to visualize SpoIIIE by PALM, Developed the project and interpreted the results, Wrote the manuscript
contribution.con3: S-HL, Developed the algorithm for qPALM, Developed the project and interpreted the results
contribution.con5: TF, Constructed the strains to visualize SpoIIIE by PALM
